examples: $ commercelayer resources:all customers -f id,email -i customer_group -s updated_at
$ cl res:all -i customer_group -f customer_groups/name -w customer_group_name_eq="GROUP NAME"

fields.name: fields
fields.description: comma separeted list of fields in the format [resource]=field1,field2...

json.name: json
json.description: convert output in standard JSON format

raw.name: raw
raw.description: print out the raw API response

doc.name: doc
doc.description: shows the CLI command in a specific language

lang.name: lang
lang.description: show the CLI command in the specified language syntax

curl.name: curl
curl.description: show the equivalent cURL command of the CLI command

node.name: node
node.description: show the equivalent Node SDK source code of the CLI command

save-args.name: save-args
save-args.description: save command data to file for future use

where.name: where
where.description: comma separated list of query filters

save-path.name: save-path
save-path.description: save command output to file and create missing path directories

notify.name: notify
notify.description: force system notification when export has finished

header.name: header
header.description: rename column headers defining a comma-separated list of values field:"renamed title"

blind.name: blind
blind.description: execute in blind mode without prompt and progress bar

resources:args.description: show all the saved command arguments

alias.name: alias
alias.description: the alias associated to saved command arguments

delete.name: delete
delete.description: delete saved arguments associated to the alias
